physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a group of men sitting on a short flight of steps outside of living quarters. There are six men in the photograph. They are dressed in varied clothing; some are in military uniform with short sleeved collared tops and mid-lengthed pants, while others are in a vasual singlet and shorts. There are some small tears along the right side of the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Outside our quarters, Naval Base Singapore 1941
subject_terms_1: world wars soldiers dwellings group portraits
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Soldiers Dwellings Portraits, Group Photography Singapore Naval Base
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
